title: Letcombe Regis Walks

images.title: andrew auger / Thatched cottages in Letcombe Regis
images.caption: Thatched cottages in Letcombe Regis

images.title: Steve Matthews / River exiting old watercress beds in Letcombe Regis
images.caption: River exiting old watercress beds. This is the eastern end of the watercress beds. The river cuts a small valley as it heads north east towards Letcombe Regis.

images.title: Andrew Smith / Bridleway, Letcombe Bassett
images.caption: Bridleway, Letcombe Bassett. The right of way descends gradually towards Bassett Road, the road between Letcombe Bassett and Letcombe Regis. The downs in the background rise towards Segsbury (hill-fort).

images.title: andrew auger / House at Letcombe Bassett
images.caption: House at Letcombe Bassett. Viewed from the churchyard, facing roughly north west

images.title: Chris Heaton / Ridgeway outside Segsbury Camp
images.caption: Ridgeway outside Segsbury Camp. The National Trail passes just to the south of the Iron Age Fort, at this point.

images.title: Looking down Castle Hill to Letcombe Regis by Steve Daniels, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Looking down Castle Hill to Letcombe Regis

images.title: The embankment around Segsbury Castle by Steve Daniels, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The embankment around Segsbury Castle. The fort has extensive ditch and ramparts and four gateways.

description: This Oxfordshire based village includes a pleasant local nature reserve and a noteworthy Iron Age hill fort on the Ridgeway National Trail. This circular walk from the village takes you through the Letcombe Valley Nature Reserve to Letcombe Bassett before heading south to pick up the The Ridgeway and visit Segsbury or Letcombe Castle Hill Fort. The walk starts in the village and starts by heading south past Letcombe Manor and the Letcombe Brook. Follow the brook south west and it will take you to Letcombe Bassett, passing through a secluded nature reserve on the way. There are some handy information plaques telling you all about the flora and fauna you can see around the brook. At the end of the reserve you head south to link up with the Ridgeway around Smith's Hill Farm. Follow the waymarked footpath east and you will soon come to the hill fort where there are some splendid views over the area. From the fort you can then head north along the Warborough country lane which will take you back into the village.
